as if guessing Rost6v's thought. 
Beneath his smile Rostov saw in him the mood he had shown at the Club dinner and at other times, when as if tired of everyday life he had felt a need to escape from it by some strange, and usually cruel, action. 
Rost6v felt ill at ease. He tried, but failed, to find some joke with which to reply to D61ok- hov's words. But before he had thought of any- thing, D61okhov, looking straight in his face, said slowly and deliberately so that everyone could
